item.title: Hayley add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Do I dare Disturb the universe? In a minute there is time For decisions and revisions which a minute will reverse." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Hayley add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "why shouldn't he? All life is just a progression toward and then a recession from one phrase-- 'I love you" -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Hayley add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description:
"And he could not tell why the struggle was worthwhile, why he had determined to use the utmost himself and his heritage from the personalities he had passed...
He stretched out his arms to the crystalline, radiant sky.
I know myself," he cried, "But that is all." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Hayley add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Later she remembered all the hours of the afternoon as happy -- one of those uneventful times that seem at the moment only a link between past and future pleasure, but turn out to have been the pleasure itself." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Gilda Radner
item.description: "I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end. Life is about not knowing, having to change, taking the moment and making the best of it, without knowing what's going to happen next. Delicious Ambiguity." -- Gilda Radner

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The major problem&mdash;<i>one</i> of the major problems, for there are several&mdash;one of the many major problems with governing people is that of whom you get to do it; or rather of who manages to get people to let them do it to them. To summarize: it is a well-known fact that those people who must <i>want</i> to rule people are, ipso facto, those least suited to do it. To summarize the summary: anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The holy passion of Friendship is of so sweet and steady and loyal and enduring a nature that it will last through a whole lifetime, if not asked to lend money." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Hayley add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"since feeling is first who pays any attention to the syntax of things will never wholly kiss you;
wholly to be a fool while Spring is in the world
my blood approves, and kisses are a far better fate than wisdom lady i swear by all flowers. Don't cry --the best gesture of my brain is less than your eyelids' flutter which says
we are for eachother: then laugh, leaning back in my arms for life's not a paragraph
And death i think is no parenthesis" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Hayley add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I became insane, with long intervals of horrible sanity." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Hayley add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "O Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo? Deny thy father refuse thy name, thou art thyself thou not a montegue, what is montegue? tis nor hand nor foot nor any other part belonging to a man What is in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet, So Romeo would were he not Romeo called retain such dear perfection to which he owes without that title, Romeo, Doth thy name! And for that name which is no part of thee, take all thyself." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "To you, I'm an atheist. To God, I'm the loyal opposition." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "The covers of this book are too far apart." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it." -- Mae West

item.title: Hayley add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident." -- Mark Twain
